info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 12 at 12:18PM MST until December 14 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...PLAINS BLIZZARD DEVELOPING BY TUESDAY MORNING... .A strong winter storm system will produce blizzard conditions over northeastern Colorado late tonight through Tuesday. Strong winds are expected to gust up to 60 mph. The heaviest snow is expected to be on the plains east of Greeley and Denver, focusing toward the Akron, Sterling, and possibly Fort Morgan areas. If you are planning travel north or east of Denver Tuesday, you should consider changing your plans to avoid travel during the day on Thursday. Travel will be difficult to impossible and road closures are likely. Those with outdoor livestock interests should prepare now for likely blizzard conditions on Tuesday and continued cold and windy weather behind the storm Wednesday and Thursday. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO MIDNIGHT MST TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Limon. * WHEN...Snow will develop by Tuesday morning, with near blizzard conditions possible during the day Tuesday. Conditions should improve late Tuesday but some blowing and drifting snow will continue Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Roads will likely become slick and hazardous. Snow and blowing snow will reduce visibility.
info.instruction: Consider altering your travel plans. Heavy snowfall is expected to make travel very difficult to impossible. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.
